intro: Phyllorkis cylindracea, commonly known as the narrow-leaved rock daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It is a perennial herb with a low-growing, mat-forming habit, characterized by its narrow, cylindrical leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale blue flowers arranged in a dense, cylindrical inflorescence. It thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Phyllorkis cylindracea is often found in coastal and inland regions, contributing to the biodiversity of its native habitat.
